instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Does not install any system.
threads.message:
Good afternoon, I have this mac that does not install any macOS, high Sierra, mojave, catalina system, none. In the apple's own test, connecting the machine holding D, says the following "one of the memories is defective". I would like to know which one of the 4 memories on the board is defective ?
Ahh is there a way to replace these memories by removing them from another board of the same model <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Does not install any system.
threads.message:
You should try to reball them first.
Or replace them directly, if have donor board.
